events.message: The policyholder reported a vehicle collision that occurred last night involving their car and another vehicle on the highway.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident case based on the initial report and damage description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer and coordinate the subsequent steps in the claims process.
The customer was notified that their auto accident claim was received and is now under review by the claims department.
The claims team requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos, the official police report, and an auto repair shop estimate.
An investigator began reviewing the submitted documents and will assess the circumstances of the accident and liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and evaluation of the vehicle damage to determine appropriate settlement.
Based on the investigation, a settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repair costs minus the deductible.
The customer acknowledged the settlement proposal and expressed appreciation for the quick resolution of their claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after the customer agreed to the settlement terms.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was processed and sent to the customerâ€™s account for the vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation from the customer.
The case documents and correspondence were archived securely to maintain records for future reference if required.
